WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream.summary: The WebTransportDatagramDuplexStream interface of the {{domxref("WebTransport API", "WebTransport API", "", "nocode")}} represents a duplex stream that can be used for unreliable transport of datagrams between client and server. Provides access to a for reading incoming datagrams, a for writing outgoing datagrams, and various settings and statistics related to the stream.

remarks.para: This is accessed via the property.

"Unreliable" means that transmission of data is not guaranteed, nor is arrival in a specific order. This is fine in some situations and provides very fast delivery. For example, you might want to transmit regular game state updates where each message supersedes the last one that arrives, and order is not important.

WebTransportDatagramDuplexStreamOutgoing.summary: The outgoingMaxAge property of the interface gets or sets the maximum age for outgoing datagrams, in milliseconds.
WebTransportDatagramDuplexStreamOutgoing.value: A number, or null if no maximum age has been set.

WebTransportDatagramDuplexStreamReadable.summary: The readable read-only property of the interface returns a instance that can be used to unreliably read incoming datagrams from the stream.

remarks.para: "Unreliably" means that transmission of data is not guaranteed, nor is arrival in a specific order. This is fine in some situations and provides very fast delivery. For example, you might want to transmit regular game state updates where each message supersedes the last one that arrives, and order is not important.

WebTransportDatagramDuplexStreamIncoming.summary: The incomingMaxAge property of the interface gets or sets the maximum age for incoming datagrams, in milliseconds.
WebTransportDatagramDuplexStreamIncoming.value: A number, or null if no maximum age has been set.

WebTransportDatagramDuplexStreamMaxDatag.summary: The maxDatagramSize read-only property of the interface returns the maximum allowable size of outgoing datagrams, in bytes, that can be written to .

WebTransportDatagramDuplexStreamWritable.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The writable read-only property of the interface returns a instance that can be used to unreliably write outgoing datagrams to the stream.

remarks.para: "Unreliably" means that transmission of data is not guaranteed, nor is arrival in a specific order. This is fine in some situations and provides very fast delivery. For example, you might want to transmit regular game state updates where each message supersedes the last one that arrives, and order is not important.

WebTransportDatagramDuplexStreamIncoming.summary: The incomingHighWaterMark property of the interface gets or sets the high water mark for incoming chunks of data — this is the maximum size, in chunks, that the incoming 's internal queue can reach before it is considered full. See Internal queues and queuing strategies for more information.

WebTransportDatagramDuplexStreamOutgoing.summary: The outgoingHighWaterMark property of the interface gets or sets the high water mark for outgoing chunks of data — this is the maximum size, in chunks, that the outgoing 's internal queue can reach before it is considered full. See Internal queues and queuing strategies for more information.
